info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 10:10PM CDT until September 23 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Nebraska, including the following county, Polk.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1007 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a slow-moving thunderstorm along the Polk-Butler County line. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have already fallen between Shelby and Columbus, and another 1 to 2 inches is possible before rain likely moves out during the next hour. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Clear Creek and North Branch Big Blue River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of far northeastern Polk County, including the Highway 81 corridor between Shelby and Columbus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT TUESDAY
